analyzed: gal te de mchis par gyur na de'i mthus ri brags pa 'di phebs par 'gyur ba gang lags pa de lta bu gnas mchis par 'gyur gda'o // rgyal pos khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la khyim bdag mthong @174a * //

analyzed: bar 'dod do zhes yi ge spring ba dang / khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin der 'ongs so //

analyzed: de lta na yang ri brags pa de ma phebs nas /
translated: But the mountain man did not come.

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala

original: khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la smras pa /
translated: said to the householder Anāthapiṇḍada,

original: khyim bdag khye'u dag mi dran nam /
analyzed: khyim bdag khye'u dag mi dran nam /
translated: “Householder, do you not remember the boys?”

original: lha khye'u dag mi dran te /
analyzed: lha khye'u dag mi dran te /
translated: “Your Majesty, I do not forget the boys.

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa dag mthong bar 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa dag mthong bar 'tshal lo //
translated: I would like to see the noble ones.”

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala

original: dge 'dun la /
analyzed: dge 'dun la /
translated: sent a letter to the Saṅgha,

analyzed: 'phags pa dag mthong bar 'tshal lo zhes yi ge spring ba dang / dge skos kyis dge 'dun gyi dbus su yi ge bklags te /
translated: saying, “I would like to see the noble ones.” The scribe read the letter in the middle of the Saṅgha,

analyzed: gang der 'gro bar spro ba des tshul shing long shig ces /
translated: saying, “Whoever is willing to go there should take a voting stick.”

analyzed: tshul shing brims pa dang / dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: kho bo cag ni rgan po sbyor mi bzod pa dag yin pas der 'gro mi nus so //

original: dge slong gsar bu gsar bu dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong gsar bu gsar bu dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: der chos bstan par bya dgos na /

analyzed: bdag cag ni thos pa nyung ba yin pas chos bstan par mi nus na /

analyzed: der chu brim par bya'am ci /
translated: What are we going to do, distribute water there?

original: bdag cag kyang der 'gro mi nus so //
analyzed: bdag cag kyang der 'gro mi nus so //
translated: We can’t even go there.”

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,

analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' ji srid du bcom ldan 'das bzhugs shing /
translated: “Nandaka, as long as the Blessed One is alive

analyzed: bdag cag gson pa de srid du bstan pa gnas la /
translated: and we are alive, the teaching will remain.

original: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das shing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das shing /

original: bdag cag dus la bab pa na /
analyzed: bdag cag dus la bab pa na /

original: bstan pa nub par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: bstan pa nub par brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: ji srid du bdag cag gson pa de srid du bstan pa la gces pa bskyed par byas /

analyzed: tshul shing blang ngo zhes de dag gis tshul shing blangs te der dong nas rgyal po la chos bstan pas /
translated: They took up the voting stick and went there. When they taught the Dharma to the king,

original: rgyal po mngon par dad par byas so //
analyzed: rgyal po mngon par dad par byas so //
translated: he developed faith.

original: btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dag dang / zhang blon dang / khrom gyi ru sna dag la yang chos bstan pas skye bo phal po che'i tshogs mngon par dad par byas so //

translated: He taught the Dharma to the queens, princes, ministers, and leaders of the merchants, and so caused a great crowd of people to develop faith.

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi blon po rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi blon po rnams la smras pa /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala said to his ministers,🔽“Let us go and lay siege to the hill fort.”

analyzed: ri brags pa bskor du dong ro zhes de dag 'phags pa dang / drug sde dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' bdag cag gis yun ji srid du gzhan gyi spyod lam gyis gnas par bya'am //
translated: “Nandaka and Upanandaka, how long are we to live by the conduct of others?🔽Let us go like a great army with a large belly.” They went to the hill fort and settled in.

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: they said,

original: 'phags pa dag shul phye shig / ci bya /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag shul phye shig / ci bya /
translated: “Noble ones, open the way!”🔽“What for?”

original: dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa mchi'o //
analyzed: dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa mchi'o //

original: bkren pa dag 'di 'dra ba dag glang po che yin nam /
analyzed: bkren pa dag 'di 'dra ba dag glang po che yin nam /
translated: “You miserable wretches, are these your elephants?”

original: phag 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag gi mche ba dag nas bzung ste /
analyzed: phag 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag gi mche ba dag nas bzung ste /

original: mtha' gcig tu bong ro //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu bong ro //
translated: They threw them to one side.

original: 'di 'dra ba dag rta yin nam bong bu 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag gi mjug ma dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu por ro //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba dag rta yin nam bong bu 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag gi mjug ma dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu por ro //
translated: They said, Are these horses or donkeys? and grabbed them by the tail.🔽They threw them to one side.

original: 'di 'dra ba dag shing rta yin nam /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba dag shing rta yin nam /
translated: They said, Are these chariots or broken carts? and grabbed them by the axle.

original: shing rta zhig pa dag 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag gi srog shing dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro //
analyzed: shing rta zhig pa dag 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag gi srog shing dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro //
translated: They threw them to one side.

analyzed: 'di 'dra ba dag mi yin nam rtsva mi dag 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag gi gnya' bdag nas bzung ste /
translated: They said, Are these men or grass men? and grabbed them by the neck.

analyzed: mtha' gcig tu bor nas de dag sems khong du chud nas 'khod do // ji tsam na ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal 'ongs nas des smras pa /

analyzed: shes ldan dag ci'i phyir khyed cag mi dong bar sems khong du chud cing 'khod /

original: lha bdag cag rgyal bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: lha bdag cag rgyal bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: They said, Your Majesty, how can we be victorious?🔽 They told him what had happened.

analyzed: 'di ltar dge sbyong mgo reg ras yul chen glegs pa /
translated: The king said, This is a shaven-headed ascetic.

analyzed: 'tshal ba 'di dag mi mchi dgu mchi'o //

original: gang dag /'phags pa drug sde dag go //🔽shes ldan dag / de dag ni dge sbyong hral po dag yin pas de dag gis smras pas khyed la ci gnod deng shig / ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bsams pa /

translated: They said, The noble group of six.🔽Sirs, they are shaven-headed ascetics who are frauds.🔽What harm can they do by speaking? Go! King Prasenajit of Kosala thought, They will continue to harass me again and again.

original: 'di dag yang dang yang du bdag la tho 'tshams par 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas /
analyzed: 'di dag yang dang yang du bdag la tho 'tshams par 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas /

analyzed: btsun pa 'phags pa 'di dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchis nas /

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /

analyzed: dge slong la dmag chas pa la ltar 'gro ba de lta bu'i rkyen zhig byung na /

analyzed: dge slong des dmag de'i nang du zhag gnyis tshun chad gnas par bya'o //

original: de las lhag par @175a * //
analyzed: de las lhag par @175a * //

original: yul ni mnyan yod /

analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs so //

analyzed: chas pa la zhes bya ba la ni g-yul 'gyed par mngon par dga' ba la'o //

analyzed: de lta bu'i rkyen zhig byung na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If such and such conditions arise” means

analyzed: rgyal po dang / btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang / zhang blon dang / khrom gyi ru sna dang / grong rdal gyi mi dang / ljongs kyi mis bkug na'o //

analyzed: dmag de'i nang du zhes bya ba ni dmag chas pa de'i nang du'o // zhag gnyis tshun chad gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In the midst of the army” means in the midst of the army that has been mobilized.🔽“He should stay for two nights” means

analyzed: zhag gnyis kyi mtha' tshun chad gnas par bya ba'o //

translated: “If he stays longer than that” means

translated: if he stays longer than that.

translated: If a monk is summoned by a king, queen, prince, minister, head of a guild, town person, or country person, or if he is under the power of an obstacle, he may stay in the army for more than two days and nights, but not until the first dawn of the third day.

original: rgyal po la sogs pas bkug pa dang / bar chad kyi dbang de dag med @175b par lta ba'i don nyid kyis g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag de'i nang du nyin mtshan gsum pa'i snga ma nyin mtshan gcig dang / gnyis kyi mthar gnas na yang dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pas bkug pa dang / bar chad kyi dbang de dag med @175b par lta ba'i don nyid kyis g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag de'i nang du nyin mtshan gsum pa'i snga ma nyin mtshan gcig dang / gnyis kyi mthar gnas na yang dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If he is not summoned by a king, etc., or is not under the power of an obstacle, he may stay in the army for one day and night, but not until the second dawn.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
translated: The agent of this downfall is

original: rgyal po la sogs pas bkug pa dang / bar chad kyi dbang de dag yod na g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag gi nang du /
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pas bkug pa dang / bar chad kyi dbang de dag yod na g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag gi nang du /
translated: If there is a king or other who summons him, or if there is an obstacle, then it is in the midst of an army that delights in battle.

original: skya rengs gsum pa shar ba dang / de dag med par zhag gcig dang gnyis kyi skya rengs shar ba'o //
analyzed: skya rengs gsum pa shar ba dang / de dag med par zhag gcig dang gnyis kyi skya rengs shar ba'o //
translated: If there is no such reason, then it is when the third dawn breaks.

analyzed: zan gcod du 'jud pa dang / me la reg pa dang / 'dun pa phyir bsgyur ba dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal pa dang / lta ba'i rnam pa mi gtong pa dang / spangs pa'i rjes su phyogs pa dang /
translated: They are: making someone fast, touching fire, turning away intent, sleeping with someone not complete, not giving up views, following an expelled monk,

original: bsnyil ba sdud pa dang / kha ma bsgyur ba'i gos gyon pa dang / longs pa'i gzhir gtogs pa dang / khrus byed pa'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: bsnyil ba sdud pa dang / kha ma bsgyur ba'i gos gyon pa dang / longs pa'i gzhir gtogs pa dang / khrus byed pa'i ltung byed do //
translated: reconciling a schism, wearing undyed robes, belonging to a basis of enjoyment, and bathing.

original: de la zan gcod du 'jud pa'i ltung byed kyi glen gzhi ni /
analyzed: de la zan gcod du 'jud pa'i ltung byed kyi glen gzhi ni /
translated: The basis of the downfall that requires confession alone for making someone fast is as follows.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed gyi tshal mgon med zas kyi sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed gyi tshal mgon med zas kyi sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: dga' bo'i lhan cig gnas pa dge slong ches zhes bya ba ngo tsha shes pa 'gyod pa dang ldan pa bsdams pa dang / bslab pa 'dod pa zhig yod pa des ji srid du de gnas ngan len kun du spyod par mi shes pa de srid du de dang lhan cig gnas so //
analyzed: dga' bo'i lhan cig gnas pa dge slong ches zhes bya ba ngo tsha shes pa 'gyod pa dang ldan pa bsdams pa dang / bslab pa 'dod pa zhig yod pa des ji srid du de gnas ngan len kun du spyod par mi shes pa de srid du de dang lhan cig gnas so //
translated: There was a monk named Nanda, who was the companion of Nanda, who had a sense of shame, remorse, restraint, and a desire for training. As long as he did not know that Nanda was engaging in misconduct, he stayed with him.

original: gang gi tshe de gnas ngan len kun du spyod par shes pa de'i tshe na de rang bzhin du gnas pa'i dge slong rnams dang lhan cig gnas par brtsams te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de gnas ngan len kun du spyod par shes pa de'i tshe na de rang bzhin du gnas pa'i dge slong rnams dang lhan cig gnas par brtsams te /
translated: But when he knew that Nanda was engaging in misconduct, then he began to stay with monks who were naturally restrained.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' lung gis dus gsum du rkang pa la phyag 'tshal du 'gro ba 'ba' zhig byed de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' lung gis dus gsum du rkang pa la phyag 'tshal du 'gro ba 'ba' zhig byed de /
translated: By the Blessed One’s order, he went three times a day to bow at Nanda’s feet.

original: nyi dags dga' bo la smras pa /
analyzed: nyi dags dga' bo la smras pa /
translated: The sun-like Nanda said to him:

original: slob dpon chos 'dis kho bo sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi mdun du tho btsams pa la ltos /
analyzed: slob dpon chos 'dis kho bo sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi mdun du tho btsams pa la ltos /
translated: “Look, Master, at how this monk has slandered me in front of the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks.

original: kho bos kyang 'di la nges par gnod pa cung zhig bya'o //
analyzed: kho bos kyang 'di la nges par gnod pa cung zhig bya'o //
translated: I will definitely do him some harm.”

original: dga' bos smras pa /
analyzed: dga' bos smras pa /
translated: Nanda said,

original: dge slong chos 'di ni ngo tsha shes pa /
analyzed: dge slong chos 'di ni ngo tsha shes pa /
translated: “Monk, this Dharma is modest,

original: 'gyod pa dang ldan pa bsdams pa /
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang ldan pa bsdams pa /
translated: has regret, is restrained,

original: bslab pa 'dod pa yin pas /
analyzed: bslab pa 'dod pa yin pas /
translated: and desires training.

original: khyod kyis 'di la gnod pa ci zhig byar yod /🔽nges par 'di ni zan @181a * //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'di la gnod pa ci zhig byar yod / nges par 'di ni zan @181a * //
translated: What harm can you do to him?

original: gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: gcad par bya'o //
translated: I will definitely fast today.”

original: de ni nus so //
analyzed: de ni nus so //
translated: “That is possible.”

original: khyim bdag cig gis dga' bo dang nye dga' gnyis zan la mgron du bos pa dang / nye dags bsams pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag cig gis dga' bo dang nye dga' gnyis zan la mgron du bos pa dang / nye dags bsams pa /
translated: A householder invited both Nanda and Upasena to a meal. Upasena thought,

original: deng chos 'di'i zan gcad par bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: deng chos 'di'i zan gcad par bya'o snyam nas /
translated: “Today I will fast from Dharma.”

original: chos dga' bo'i gnang du bsod snyoms la 'gro bar zhur 'ong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: chos dga' bo'i gnang du bsod snyoms la 'gro bar zhur 'ong ba'i tshe /
translated: When it was time for Dharma to go for alms, he asked for permission to go.

original: dga' bos chos la smras pa /
analyzed: dga' bos chos la smras pa /
translated: Nanda said to Dharma,

original: chos kho bo cag deng khyim bdag cig gis zan la mgron du bos kyis tshur shog la de nyid du zan zo shig / des smras pa /
analyzed: chos kho bo cag deng khyim bdag cig gis zan la mgron du bos kyis tshur shog la de nyid du zan zo shig / des smras pa /
translated: The monk replied, I have been invited to a householder's house for a meal today, so come along and eat there.

original: lhung bzed dang chu tshags blangs te mchi'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chu tshags blangs te mchi'o //
translated: The monk said, I will take my begging bowl and water filter.

original: nye dags smras pa /
analyzed: nye dags smras pa /
translated: Udayin said,

original: der lhung bzed dang chu tshags kyis ci bya /
analyzed: der lhung bzed dang chu tshags kyis ci bya /
translated: What will you do with a begging bowl and water filter there?

original: der snod bkrus pa dang / chu tshags dag 'bogs kyis tshur shog 'dong ngo //
analyzed: der snod bkrus pa dang / chu tshags dag 'bogs kyis tshur shog 'dong ngo //
translated: The dishes will be washed there, and the water filter will be used to strain the water. Come along!

original: de de gnyis dang lhan cig mnyan yod du zhugs pa dang / de gnyis srang du dong ste /
analyzed: de de gnyis dang lhan cig mnyan yod du zhugs pa dang / de gnyis srang du dong ste /
translated: The two of them entered Śrāvastī, and the two of them went to the street.

original: tshong khang du 'khod nas /
analyzed: tshong khang du 'khod nas /
translated: They sat down in a shop.

original: nye dags khyim bdag de'i khyim du song ste /
analyzed: nye dags khyim bdag de'i khyim du song ste /
translated: Udayin went to the householder's house,

original: zas zos nas phyir 'ongs so //
analyzed: zas zos nas phyir 'ongs so //
translated: ate his meal, and returned.

original: de'i 'og tu dga' bo yang khyim bdag de'i khyim du dong ste zan za zhing 'dug go //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dga' bo yang khyim bdag de'i khyim du dong ste zan za zhing 'dug go //
translated: After that, Nanda also went to the householder's house and sat down to eat.

original: chos kyis nye dga' la smras pa /
analyzed: chos kyis nye dga' la smras pa /
translated: Dharma saw Udayin and said,

original: slob dpon gdugs tshod bab kyis bzhud do //
analyzed: slob dpon gdugs tshod bab kyis bzhud do //
translated: Preceptor, it is time for the midday meal. Let us go.

original: nye dags smras pa /
analyzed: nye dags smras pa /
translated: Udayin said,

original: der thams cad sta gon byas zin pas der song ste /
analyzed: der thams cad sta gon byas zin pas der song ste /
translated: they said, “We have already prepared everything.

original: bza' ba las gzhan pa'i bya ba ci yang med kyis /
analyzed: bza' ba las gzhan pa'i bya ba ci yang med kyis /
translated: We have nothing to do but eat.

original: gdugs tshod kyi kha kho nar 'dong ngo //
analyzed: gdugs tshod kyi kha kho nar 'dong ngo //
translated: Let us go to the dining hall.”

original: chos langs te rkang pa gnyis kyis grib tshod gzhal bar brtsams pa dang / nye dags smras pa /
analyzed: chos langs te rkang pa gnyis kyis grib tshod gzhal bar brtsams pa dang / nye dags smras pa /
translated: Dharma rose and began to measure the time with his feet. Udayin said,

original: glen pa khyod kho bo cag gi bslab pa la cung zad yid mi ches sam /
analyzed: glen pa khyod kho bo cag gi bslab pa la cung zad yid mi ches sam /
translated: “You fool, do you not have the slightest faith in our training?

original: ci khyod kyi snying lam na kho bo cag dus ma yin par za bar 'gyur snyam mam /🔽kho bo khyod dang lhan cig smra ba'am /
analyzed: ci khyod kyi snying lam na kho bo cag dus ma yin par za bar 'gyur snyam mam / kho bo khyod dang lhan cig smra ba'am /
translated: Do you think we eat at the wrong time?

original: 'dug pa bde ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dug pa bde ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not pleasant for me to talk or sit with you.🔽I am happy when I am alone. Go away.”

original: 'di ltar kho bo gcig pu kho na smra'am 'dug na bdes khyod song shig / chos kyis bsams pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo gcig pu kho na smra'am 'dug na bdes khyod song shig / chos kyis bsams pa /
translated: Dharma thought,

original: gal te bdag gis lhung bzed dang chu tshags khyer te 'ongs par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bdag gis lhung bzed dang chu tshags khyer te 'ongs par gyur na /
translated: “If I had brought my alms bowl and water filter,

original: bdag bsod snyoms la rgyu bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: bdag bsod snyoms la rgyu bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: I could have gone for alms.

original: da ni ci byar yang med do snyam nas /
analyzed: da ni ci byar yang med do snyam nas /
translated: But now there is nothing I can do.”

original: de gtsug lag khang du song ste /
analyzed: de gtsug lag khang du song ste /
translated: He went to the monastery.

original: ji srid du de'i lus las mdangs ma yal ba de srid du dge ba'i phyogs la tron byas nas /🔽gang gi tshe de'i lus las mdangs yal ba de'i tshe na glos phab ste nyal ba dang / dge slong rnams kyis de la smras pa /
analyzed: ji srid du de'i lus las mdangs ma yal ba de srid du dge ba'i phyogs la tron byas nas / gang gi tshe de'i lus las mdangs yal ba de'i tshe na glos phab ste nyal ba dang / dge slong rnams kyis de la smras pa /
translated: As long as his body was not drained of its luster, he was able to work on behalf of virtue.

original: tshe dang ldan pa chos gal te zan gzhan gyi @181b yin zhes te lto yang gzhan gyi yin nam ci na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa chos gal te zan gzhan gyi @181b yin zhes te lto yang gzhan gyi yin nam ci na /
translated: But when his body was drained of its luster, he fell over and lay down. The monks said to him, “Venerable Dharmaruci, if the food is another’s, is the stomach also another’s?”

original: ji tsam gyis dge ba'i phyogs la tron byed kyang mi nus pa /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis dge ba'i phyogs la tron byed kyang mi nus pa /
translated: “How is it that you are unable to work on behalf of virtue

original: de tsam gyi zan zos so //
analyzed: de tsam gyi zan zos so //
translated: even after eating so much food?”🔽“Who ate it?”

original: sus zos / khyod kyis zos sam /
analyzed: sus zos / khyod kyis zos sam /
translated: “Did you eat it?”

original: ma zos so //🔽ci'i phyir des skabs de rgyas par brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag ched du bsams te /
analyzed: ma zos so // ci'i phyir des skabs de rgyas par brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag ched du bsams te /
translated: “I didn’t eat it.”

original: dge slong gi zan gcod du 'jug ces smod par byed /
analyzed: dge slong gi zan gcod du 'jug ces smod par byed /
translated: “Why?” He told them what had happened, and the monks with few desires complained and criticized him, “Why do monks intentionally make monks fast?”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /🔽kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /🔽kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
translated: They criticized him,🔽“How could a monk do such a thing?”

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du dge slong gang klan ka tshol zhing ci nas kyang /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du dge slong gang klan ka tshol zhing ci nas kyang /
translated: Then the Blessed One, as before, said, “Monks, if someone seeks to find fault with a monk, thinking,

original: dge slong 'di la klan ka btsal bar 'gyur ro snyam pa de nyid rkyen du byas te /
analyzed: dge slong 'di la klan ka btsal bar 'gyur ro snyam pa de nyid rkyen du byas te /
translated: ‘How can I find fault with this monk?’

original: dge slong la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog / khyim dag du 'dong dang / der khyod la bca' ba dang bza' ba bsod pa dag ji tsam 'dod pa sbyin du gzhug go zhes smras nas /
analyzed: dge slong la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog / khyim dag du 'dong dang / der khyod la bca' ba dang bza' ba bsod pa dag ji tsam 'dod pa sbyin du gzhug go zhes smras nas /
translated: and says to the monk, ‘Venerable, come, let’s go to the houses. I will have you given as much good food and drink as you want,’

original: des de la sbyin du ma bcug par de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa kho bo khyod dang lhan cig smra 'am 'dug pa bde ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des de la sbyin du ma bcug par de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa kho bo khyod dang lhan cig smra 'am 'dug pa bde ba ma yin gyi /
translated: and then, without having had anything given to him, says, ‘Venerable, it is not pleasant for me to talk or sit with you.

original: 'di ltar kho bo gcig pu kho na smra'am 'dug na bdes khyod song shing ces zer na /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo gcig pu kho na smra'am 'dug na bdes khyod song shing ces zer na /
translated: It is pleasant for me to talk or sit by myself. You should go away,’

original: ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: then that monk too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni nye dga'/
analyzed: gang zag ni nye dga'/
translated: The person was Udayin.

original: nyon mongs pa ni zhe gdug / nyes pa ni ched du bsams te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni zhe gdug / nyes pa ni ched du bsams te /
translated: Affliction is hatred.  Fault is intentional.

original: dge slong gi zan gcod du 'jud pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi zan gcod du 'jud pa'o //
translated: Affliction is hatred. Fault is the intention to deprive a monk of food.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga'am /
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga'am /
translated: In this case, monk refers to Upasena, the son of the Sakyans,

original: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //🔽klan ka tshol zhing ci nas kyang dge slong 'di la klan ka btsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o // klan ka tshol zhing ci nas kyang dge slong 'di la klan ka btsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or anyone else like him.🔽He seeks an opportunity, thinking, How can I find an opportunity to accuse this monk?

original: snyam pa zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang dge slong 'di'i zan gcod du bcug par 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
analyzed: snyam pa zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang dge slong 'di'i zan gcod du bcug par 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
translated: He thinks, How can I deprive this monk of food?

original: de nyid rkyen du byas te zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rkyen du byas te zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pa'o //
translated: Taking that as the basis means not anything else.

original: dge slong la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa la'o //🔽'di skad ces bya ba ni 'di skad ces smras nas so //
analyzed: dge slong la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa la'o // 'di skad ces bya ba ni 'di skad ces smras nas so //
translated: A monk is one who follows this doctrine.

original: tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog / khyim dag du 'dong dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog / khyim dag du 'dong dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what he says: Come, Venerable, let us go to the houses.

original: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gi khyim dag tu'o //
analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gi khyim dag tu'o //
translated: The houses of the faithful brahmins and householders.

original: der khyod la bca' ba dang bza' ba bsod pa zhes bya ba ni bza' ba lnga po dang bca' ba lnga po dag go //
analyzed: der khyod la bca' ba dang bza' ba bsod pa zhes bya ba ni bza' ba lnga po dang bca' ba lnga po dag go //
translated: “Good food and drink” means the five kinds of food and drink.

original: ji tsam 'dod pa sbyin du gzhug go zhes smras nas zhes bya ba ni ci tsam gyis chog pa'o //
analyzed: ji tsam 'dod pa sbyin du gzhug go zhes smras nas zhes bya ba ni ci tsam gyis chog pa'o //
translated: “As much as you want” means as much as you need.

original: des de la sbyin du ma bcug par /
analyzed: des de la sbyin du ma bcug par /
translated: “He does not let him give it” means he does not let him give it to him.

original: de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces /
translated: “After that, he says to him” means after that, he says this to him.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kho bo @182a * //🔽khyod dang lhan cig smra'am 'dug pa bde ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kho bo @182a * // khyod dang lhan cig smra'am 'dug pa bde ba ma yin gyi /
translated: “Venerable” means venerable one.🔽“It is not pleasant for me to talk or sit with you” means it is not pleasant for me to talk or sit with you.

original: 'di ltar kho bo gcig pu smra'am 'dug na bdes khyod song shig ces zer na zhes bya ba ni de skad zer na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo gcig pu smra'am 'dug na bdes khyod song shig ces zer na zhes bya ba ni de skad zer na'o //
translated: “Go away” means go away.🔽“Offense” means the hells, the animal realm, the hungry ghost realm, the lower realms, and falling.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dung 'gro dang / yi dags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dung 'gro dang / yi dags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /
translated: “Burn” means burn.

original: 'tshod par byed /
analyzed: 'tshod par byed /
translated: “Cook” means cook.🔽“Offense” means the hells, the animal realm, the hungry ghost realm, the lower realms, and falling.

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Burn” means burn.🔽“Cook” means cook.🔽“Offense” means the hells, the animal realm, the hungry ghost realm, the lower realms, and falling.

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, as long as that downfall is not confessed and openly acknowledged, it obscures virtuous dharmas.

original: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called a downfall.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Here, the presentation of the actual downfall is as follows.

original: dge slong dag gis dge slong pha rol pa'i nad kyi gnyen po'i don nyid ma gtogs par ched du bsams te /
analyzed: dge slong dag gis dge slong pha rol pa'i nad kyi gnyen po'i don nyid ma gtogs par ched du bsams te /
translated: Except for the case of a monk who is a doctor, monks who, with the intention to harm,🔽cause a layperson donor to stop giving food

original: khyim pa sbyin pa po'i tshig gis bsgo bas zan gcod du bcug nas /
analyzed: khyim pa sbyin pa po'i tshig gis bsgo bas zan gcod du bcug nas /
translated: by telling him to do so,

original: zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: commit the actual downfall of causing a layperson to stop giving food.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
translated: The agent of this downfall is

original: zan gcad par bya ba dge slong nyid dag sbyin bdag khyim ba dang / zas nyid do //
analyzed: zan gcad par bya ba dge slong nyid dag sbyin bdag khyim ba dang / zas nyid do //
translated: a monk who is to be prevented from receiving food, a layperson donor, and the food itself.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the actual downfall is incurred by five factors.

original: ched du bsams pa dang / zan gcad par bya ba dge slong nyid dang / nad kyi gnyen po'i don nyid ma gtogs pa dang / sbyin pa po khyim ba dang / tshig gis bsgo ba dang zan gcod du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ched du bsams pa dang / zan gcad par bya ba dge slong nyid dang / nad kyi gnyen po'i don nyid ma gtogs pa dang / sbyin pa po khyim ba dang / tshig gis bsgo ba dang zan gcod du 'jug pa'o //
translated: The monk himself, except for the purpose of curing an illness, and the householder donor, and the one who orders the fasting and the one who makes him fast.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //

analyzed: rin po cher smos pa 'dug pa'am /

analyzed: 'di su'i yin pa de len par 'gyur grang snyam pa de lta bu'i sems kyis blang bar bya ste / de la de ni cho ga yin no zhes bya ba la /

translated: “This is the proper conduct in this case” means

analyzed: de la de ni gnang ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos yin pa'o//

analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par bzhag pa ni /

original: dge slong gis rin po che rang gi ma yin par nor bu dang / mu tig dang / beed'urya dang / shang ka shi la dang / byi ru dang / gser dang / dngul dang / rdo'i snying po dang / spug dang / dmar po dang /🔽g-yas su 'khyil pa la sogs pa bdar ba dang / phug pa nyid dang / mgul rgyan dang / gdu bu rgyan can dang / dpung rgyan dang / do shal dang / se mo do la sogs pa de dag nyid du gnas pa dang / rin po cher smos pa su'i yang rung ba /
analyzed: dge slong gis rin po che rang gi ma yin par nor bu dang / mu tig dang / beed'urya dang / shang ka shi la dang / byi ru dang / gser dang / dngul dang / rdo'i snying po dang / spug dang / dmar po dang / g-yas su 'khyil pa la sogs pa bdar ba dang / phug pa nyid dang / mgul rgyan dang / gdu bu rgyan can dang / dpung rgyan dang / do shal dang / se mo do la sogs pa de dag nyid du gnas pa dang / rin po cher smos pa su'i yang rung ba /
translated: A monk should not handle precious substances that are not his own, such as gems, pearls, lapis lazuli, conch shells, coral, gold, silver, cat’s eyes, amber, rubies,

original: g-yul ngor spyad pa'i mtshon cha gzhu rgyud dang bcas pa nyid dang / ral gri dang / ral gri khyog po dang / ral gri so gcig pa dang / mdung dang / phang mdung dang / lcags kyu la sogs pa de nyid yin pa dang /
analyzed: g-yul ngor spyad pa'i mtshon cha gzhu rgyud dang bcas pa nyid dang / ral gri dang / ral gri khyog po dang / ral gri so gcig pa dang / mdung dang / phang mdung dang / lcags kyu la sogs pa de nyid yin pa dang /
translated: or right-coiling conches. He should not handle precious substances that are in the form of ornaments, such as necklaces, bracelets, armlets, anklets, rings, earrings, and so forth, or precious substances that are in the form of weapons, such as bows and arrows, swords, spears, javelins, and hooks.

original: mda' dang / lcags mda' dang / mda' phyed lcags las byas pa la sogs pa mde'u dang bcas pa nyid dang / rol mor spyad pa'i yo byad pi bang dang / 'od ma dang / bal la ri dang / ma ha ti dang / su gho sha ka la sogs pa rgyud dang bcas pa nyid dang /
analyzed: mda' dang / lcags mda' dang / mda' phyed lcags las byas pa la sogs pa mde'u dang bcas pa nyid dang / rol mor spyad pa'i yo byad pi bang dang / 'od ma dang / bal la ri dang / ma ha ti dang / su gho sha ka la sogs pa rgyud dang bcas pa nyid dang /
translated: arrows, iron arrows, half-arrows, and so forth, with their respective arrowheads, and musical instruments such as the lute, flute, guitar, and drum, together with their strings,

original: dung dang / rnga po che dang / rnga pa ta ha dang / rdza rnga la sogs pa sgra 'byin pa nyid dang / sku gzugs sku gdung dang bcas pa nyid gtsug lag khang dang / de'i nyen kor na 'dug pa ma yin pa bdag gir bya ba dang ma 'brel bar rdzas chud mi za bar bya ba'i sems ma gtogs par reg gam /🔽reg tu bcug na /
analyzed: dung dang / rnga po che dang / rnga pa ta ha dang / rdza rnga la sogs pa sgra 'byin pa nyid dang / sku gzugs sku gdung dang bcas pa nyid gtsug lag khang dang / de'i nyen kor na 'dug pa ma yin pa bdag gir bya ba dang ma 'brel bar rdzas chud mi za bar bya ba'i sems ma gtogs par reg gam / reg tu bcug na /
translated: conchs, kettledrums, paṭaha drums, clay drums, and so forth, which produce sound, and images together with their reliquaries, which are not in a temple or its vicinity, and are not connected with one’s own use, except with the intention of not wasting the substance, if one touches them or makes another touch them,

original: longs pa'i gzhir gtogs pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: longs pa'i gzhir gtogs pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: then for each one, it is the actual basis of a downfall that is part of the general category of downfalls that require confession alone.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni rin po che dang / rin po cher smos pa dgos pa'i rung ba nyid du @194b gyur pa dang / bdag gir bya ba dang ma 'brel bar /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni rin po che dang / rin po cher smos pa dgos pa'i rung ba nyid du @194b gyur pa dang / bdag gir bya ba dang ma 'brel bar /
translated: The agent of this downfall is anyone other than a precious one, or one who is considered precious, who is suitable, who is not related to the monk by having the same benefactors, and who is not a monk.

original: rdzas chud mi za bar bya ba'i sems ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas chud mi za bar bya ba'i sems ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The downfall is accrued by the intention to waste the substance, unless the monk is insane.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The downfall is accrued by five factors:

original: rin po che rang gi ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: rin po che rang gi ma yin pa'am /
translated: the substance is precious or considered precious;

original: rin po cher smos pa'i gang yang rung ba nyid dang / de dag dgos pa'i phyir dung ba nyid du gyur pa nyid dang / gtsug lag khang dang de'i nyen kor na 'dug pa ma yin pa nyid dang / bdag gir bya ba dang ma 'brel par rdzas chud mi za bar bya ba'i sems ma gtogs pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rin po cher smos pa'i gang yang rung ba nyid dang / de dag dgos pa'i phyir dung ba nyid du gyur pa nyid dang / gtsug lag khang dang de'i nyen kor na 'dug pa ma yin pa nyid dang / bdag gir bya ba dang ma 'brel par rdzas chud mi za bar bya ba'i sems ma gtogs pa nyid dang /
translated: the monk is not related to the owner by having the same benefactors; the substance is not in a monastery or its vicinity; the monk is not insane;

original: reg gam / reg tu bcug pa nyid do //🔽de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: reg gam / reg tu bcug pa nyid do // de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: and he touches the substance or has it touched.🔽If any of these factors is absent, the downfall is not accrued.

original: longs pa'i gzhir gtogs pa'i ltung byed de lnga bcu dgu pa'o /
analyzed: longs pa'i gzhir gtogs pa'i ltung byed de lnga bcu dgu pa'o /
translated: This rule was formulated in Śrāvastī.

original: // / khrus byed pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / khrus byed pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The origin story for the downfall of bathing.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka'i gnas na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇuvana on the outskirts of Rājagṛha.

original: rgyal po'i khab na chu dron gsum yod pa gcig ni /
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab na chu dron gsum yod pa gcig ni /
translated: In Rājagṛha there were three hot springs.

original: ma ga dh'a'i rgyal po bzo sbyongs gzugs can snying po khrus byed /
analyzed: ma ga dh'a'i rgyal po bzo sbyongs gzugs can snying po khrus byed /
translated: One was used by King Bimbisāra of Magadha.

original: gnyis par ni btsun mo'i 'khor khrus byed /
analyzed: gnyis par ni btsun mo'i 'khor khrus byed /

original: gsum par ni grong rdal gyi mi dang yul mi dag khrus byed do //
analyzed: gsum par ni grong rdal gyi mi dang yul mi dag khrus byed do //
translated: The third was used by the citizens and the people of the country.

analyzed: ma ga dh'a'i rgyal po bzo sbyangs gzugs can snying pos bsams pa / bdag gis bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa la /
translated: King Bimbisāra of Magadha thought,

analyzed: rnam pa du ma'i sgo nas yo byad thams cad kyis bstabs na /
translated: “I have provided the Blessed One and the community of monks with all the necessities in many ways.

analyzed: khrus kyis ma bstabs kyis des bstabs par bya'o snyam du rig nas /
translated: But I have not provided them with a bath. I should do that.”🔽Knowing this, he asked the Blessed One,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: “Blessed One,

translated: “Venerables, in this Rājagṛha there are three hot springs. Wherever I bathe, may the noble ones also bathe there. Wherever the women of the court bathe, may the noble women also bathe there.”

original: drug sde dag la blo skyes pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag la blo skyes pa /
translated: The thought occurred to the group of six monks,

original: dga' bo nye dga' ma ga dh'a'i rgyal po bzo sbyangs gzugs can snying po dad pa dang ldan pa ni yin na /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' ma ga dh'a'i rgyal po bzo sbyangs gzugs can snying po dad pa dang ldan pa ni yin na /
translated: “Nanda and Upananda, the king of Magadha, the skilled artisan Bimbisāra, has faith.🔽Let’s go see what kind of faith he has and bathe there.”

original: dad pa ji lta bu dang ldan pa bltas khrus byed du 'dong ngo zhes de dag der khrus byed du dong nas /
analyzed: dad pa ji lta bu dang ldan pa bltas khrus byed du 'dong ngo zhes de dag der khrus byed du dong nas /

analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' gal te bdag cag thams cad cig car khrus byas na myur du zin par 'gyur gyis /

analyzed: gnyis kyis bya zhing bzhis grogs bya'o //
translated: Two should do it, and four should assist them.

analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang gnyis kyis khrus bya zhing bzhis grogs bya'o //🔽de'i 'og tu yang gnyis @195a * //

analyzed: kyis khrus bya zhing bzhis grogs bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar bya'o zhes de dag las gnyis kyis khrus bya bar brtsams te /
translated: They said, We will do that, and two of them began to bathe him.

original: bzhis grogs byed cing 'dug go //
analyzed: bzhis grogs byed cing 'dug go //
translated: The other four helped him.🔽At that time, King Bimbisāra of Magadha had also gone there to bathe. He sent a man to find out who was bathing there.

original: de'i tshe ma ga dh'a'i po bzo sbyangs gzugs can snying po yang der khrus byed du 'phags nas des mi gsang la gtogs pa zhig da ltar sus khrus byed pa rtog tu btang ba dang / des drug sde dag khrus byed par mthong nas rgyal pos der khri'u btsugs nas bsdad do //
analyzed: de'i tshe ma ga dh'a'i po bzo sbyangs gzugs can snying po yang der khrus byed du 'phags nas des mi gsang la gtogs pa zhig da ltar sus khrus byed pa rtog tu btang ba dang / des drug sde dag khrus byed par mthong nas rgyal pos der khri'u btsugs nas bsdad do //
translated: The man saw the group of six bathing. The king had a bench set up there and sat down.

original: ji tsam na yun ring zhig lon nas /
analyzed: ji tsam na yun ring zhig lon nas /
translated: After a long time,

original: yang rtog tu btang na yang de bzhin /
analyzed: yang rtog tu btang na yang de bzhin /

original: yang yun ring zhig lon nas rtog tu btang na yang de bzhin nas /
analyzed: yang yun ring zhig lon nas rtog tu btang na yang de bzhin nas /
translated: After a long time, he sent the man again, but it was the same.

original: rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos smras pa /
translated: The king said,

analyzed: shes ldan dag /'o ni dag yun ring por nga la tho 'tshams par byed /
translated: “Sirs, they have been deceiving me for a long time.

original: dbang bskur ba'i khrus kyis khrus bya'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i khrus kyis khrus bya'o //
translated: I will bathe with the consecration bath.”

original: de dag gis chu blangs nas /
analyzed: de dag gis chu blangs nas /
translated: They brought water,

original: rgyal pos de nyid du dbang bskur ba'i khrus kyis khrus byas nas /
analyzed: rgyal pos de nyid du dbang bskur ba'i khrus kyis khrus byas nas /
translated: The king bathed him right there with a coronation bath.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song nas /
translated: Then he went to the Blessed One

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /

analyzed: chos mnyan pa ma mnyan pa kho nar bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas dong ngo //
translated: Without listening to the Dharma, he left the Blessed One’s presence.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' po la smras pa dang / des rgyal po gzugs can snying po la drug sde dag gis tho 'tshams pa de rgyas par gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' po la smras pa dang / des rgyal po gzugs can snying po la drug sde dag gis tho 'tshams pa de rgyas par gsol to //
translated: The Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda, and he told King Bimbisāra in detail about the group of six monks’ harassment.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /

analyzed: nyes dmigs gang cung zad cig byung ba de ni / dge sbyong dag khrus byed pa las gyur pa yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: “Whatever little trouble there is🔽comes from the ascetics bathing.🔽Therefore, monks should not bathe, and I will allow them to bathe every half-month.”

original: dge slong rnams kyis khrus mi bya ba dang / zla ba phyed phyed cing khrus bya bar gnang ngo zhes snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis khrus mi bya ba dang / zla ba phyed phyed cing khrus bya bar gnang ngo zhes snga ma bzhin du /
translated: As before,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zla ba phyed phyed cing khrus bya bar gsungs pa de la 'dums par byed na /
translated: The Blessed One taught that one should bathe every half-month. If one reduces that,

original: dus ma gtogs te ltung byed do //
analyzed: dus ma gtogs te ltung byed do //
translated: one commits an offense entailing confession, except in the case of illness.

original: de la dus ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la dus ni 'di yin te /
translated: In this case, the following are the times:

analyzed: so ga rnams kyi zla ba lhag ma phyed dang gnyis dang / dbyar rnams kyi dang po dang zla ba phyed dang gsum po 'di dag ni tsha ba'i dus so //
translated: The two and a half months of the hot season are the remaining two and a half months of spring and the first month of summer.

original: lhag ma ni na ba dus so //
analyzed: lhag ma ni na ba dus so //
translated: The remaining months are the time of illness.

original: las dus so //
analyzed: las dus so //
translated: The time of work.

original: lam dus so //
analyzed: lam dus so //
translated: The time of travel.

original: rlung dus so //🔽char dus so //
analyzed: rlung dus so // char dus so //
translated: The time of wind.🔽The time of rain.

original: rdzi char dus so //
analyzed: rdzi char dus so //
translated: The time of drizzle.

original: de la de ni dus yin no zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de la de ni dus yin no zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: In this case, the Blessed One has made a rule that this is the time.

original: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
analyzed: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
translated: The place is Rājagṛha.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The persons are the group of six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni tho 'tshams pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni tho 'tshams pa /
translated: The affliction is disrespect.

original: nyes pa ni rgyal po'i chu kar khrus byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni rgyal po'i chu kar khrus byed pa'o //
translated: The offense is bathing at the king’s bathing place.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis @195b zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis so //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis @195b zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis so //
translated: In this case, the Blessed One is the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One.

analyzed: zla ba phyed phyed cing khrus bya bar gsungs pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And it is said that you should bathe every half month.🔽🔽

original: zla ba phyed phyed cing ngo //🔽de bas 'dums par byed na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zla ba phyed phyed cing ngo // de bas 'dums par byed na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Every half month” means every half month.

original: zla ba phyed las 'dums par byed na'o //
analyzed: zla ba phyed las 'dums par byed na'o //
translated: “If he does it earlier” means if he does it before the half month.

original: dus ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni dus bzhag ste'o //
analyzed: dus ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni dus bzhag ste'o //
translated: “Except on an occasion” means except on an occasion that is allowed.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “One commits an offense entailing confession” is as above.

original: de la dus ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la dus ni 'di yin te /
translated: The occasion is this:

original: so ga rnams kyi zla ba phyed dang gnyis dang / dbyar rnams kyi dang po dang zla ba phyed dang gsum po 'di dag ni tsha ba'i dus so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: so ga rnams kyi zla ba phyed dang gnyis dang / dbyar rnams kyi dang po dang zla ba phyed dang gsum po 'di dag ni tsha ba'i dus so zhes bya ba la /

original: so ga rnams kyi zla ba lhag ma phyed dang gnyis zhes bya ba ni /🔽zla ba phyed dang gnyis na dbyar nye bar sgrub pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: so ga rnams kyi zla ba lhag ma phyed dang gnyis zhes bya ba ni / zla ba phyed dang gnyis na dbyar nye bar sgrub pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The remaining two and a half months of spring are🔽the two and a half months of spring that precede the beginning of the rainy season.

original: dbyar zla ra ba tshes nas dbyar zla 'bring po nya'i bar gyi zla ba phyed dang gnyis so //
analyzed: dbyar zla ra ba tshes nas dbyar zla 'bring po nya'i bar gyi zla ba phyed dang gnyis so //
translated: The first month of summer is the month of Āṣāḍha.🔽The last month and a half of autumn is from the first day of the month of Kārttika up until the full moon of the month of Mārgaśīrṣa.

original: dbyar rnams kyi dang po zhes bya ba ni gnas par khas blangs pa'i dang po zla ba gcig ste /
analyzed: dbyar rnams kyi dang po zhes bya ba ni gnas par khas blangs pa'i dang po zla ba gcig ste /
translated: The first of the summers is the first month of the rainy season, which is the first month of the three-month rainy season retreat.

original: dbyar rnams kyi 'bring po tshes bcu drug nas dbyar zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig go //
analyzed: dbyar rnams kyi 'bring po tshes bcu drug nas dbyar zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig go //
translated: The middle of the summers is the month from the sixteenth day of the middle summer month until the full moon of the last summer month.

original: zla ba phyed dang gsum po 'di dag ni tsha ba'i dus so zhes bya ba ni de ltar dbyar zla ra ba tshes nas /
analyzed: zla ba phyed dang gsum po 'di dag ni tsha ba'i dus so zhes bya ba ni de ltar dbyar zla ra ba tshes nas /
translated: These three and a half months are the hot season.

original: dbyar zla 'bring po nya'i bar gyi zla ba phyed dang gnyis dang / dbyar zla 'bring po tshe bcu drug nas dbyar zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig po de rnams spyir bsdoms pa la zla ba phyed dang gsum yod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: dbyar zla 'bring po nya'i bar gyi zla ba phyed dang gnyis dang / dbyar zla 'bring po tshe bcu drug nas dbyar zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig po de rnams spyir bsdoms pa la zla ba phyed dang gsum yod pa de dag ni /
translated: Thus, the first half of the first summer month, the second half of the middle summer month, and the full moon of the last summer month are the three and a half months in which the hot season is included.

original: tsha ba'i dus yin pas de dag tu zla ba phyed las 'dums par khrus byed pa la ltung byed do //
analyzed: tsha ba'i dus yin pas de dag tu zla ba phyed las 'dums par khrus byed pa la ltung byed do //
translated: If one takes a bath for more than half a month during the hot season, one commits a minor offense.

original: lhag ma rnams ni na ba dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni na ba dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The rest of the time is the sick time.

original: dge slong na ba khrus ma byas par 'tsho bar mi nus so //
analyzed: dge slong na ba khrus ma byas par 'tsho bar mi nus so //
translated: A sick monk cannot survive without bathing.

original: las dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /🔽dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi'am /
analyzed: las dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste / dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi'am /
translated: The time of work: for example,🔽if a monk has done work for the community or

original: mchod rten gyi las than phyag dar re lde tsam mam /
analyzed: mchod rten gyi las than phyag dar re lde tsam mam /
translated: for a stūpa, even if it is only sweeping the floor or

original: byug pa ba mal tsam byas na'o //
analyzed: byug pa ba mal tsam byas na'o //
translated: rubbing the floor with a stone,

original: lam dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lam dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The time of travel: for example,

original: dge slong dpag tshad gcig tu song ngam /
analyzed: dge slong dpag tshad gcig tu song ngam /
translated: if a monk has traveled one krośa or

original: dpag tshad phyed du song ste phyir 'ongs na'o //
analyzed: dpag tshad phyed du song ste phyir 'ongs na'o //
translated: half a krośa and has returned.

original: rlung dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rlung dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The time of wind: for example,

original: tha na rlung gis gos kyi grva bsgul bar gyur na'o //
analyzed: tha na rlung gis gos kyi grva bsgul bar gyur na'o //
translated: if even the corner of a monk’s robe has been moved by the wind.

original: char dus so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: char dus so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The time of rain:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: for example,

original: tha na lus la char gyi thigs pa gnyis sam gsum bab par gyur na'o //
analyzed: tha na lus la char gyi thigs pa gnyis sam gsum bab par gyur na'o //
translated: if two or three drops of rain have fallen on a monk’s body.🔽The time of drizzle:

original: rdzi char dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rdzi char dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: for example,

original: tha na rdzi char gyis gos kyi mtha' bsgul bar gyur cing lus la char pa'i thigs pa gnyis sam gsum bab par gyur na'o //
analyzed: tha na rdzi char gyis gos kyi mtha' bsgul bar gyur cing lus la char pa'i thigs pa gnyis sam gsum bab par gyur na'o //
translated: Even if the edge of his robe is moved by a breeze and two or three drops of rain fall on his body.

original: de la de ni dus yin no zhes bya ba ni @196a * //
analyzed: de la de ni dus yin no zhes bya ba ni @196a * //

original: bslab pa'i gzhi'i bca' ba mdzad pa de la de ni gnang ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos yin pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi'i bca' ba mdzad pa de la de ni gnang ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos yin pa'o //
translated: That is the Dharma that accords with the allowance in the prescription of the basis of training.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Here, the presentation of the basic downfall is as follows.

original: dge slong na ba ma yin pa dang / las ma byas pa dang / lam du ma zhugs pa dang / rlung gis gos kyi grva ma bskul ba dang / char thigs pa gnyis kyis lus nyid la ma phog pa dang / rdzi char gyis kyang de ltar ma gyur pa dang /
analyzed: dge slong na ba ma yin pa dang / las ma byas pa dang / lam du ma zhugs pa dang / rlung gis gos kyi grva ma bskul ba dang / char thigs pa gnyis kyis lus nyid la ma phog pa dang / rdzi char gyis kyang de ltar ma gyur pa dang /
translated: A monk who is not sick, who has not done work, who has not set out on the road, whose robe edge is not moved by the wind, whose body is not struck by two drops of rain, and who is not affected by a drizzle,

original: yul aas ma pa ran ta na gnas pa ma gtogs pas dbyar zla ra ba tshes nas /
analyzed: yul aas ma pa ran ta na gnas pa ma gtogs pas dbyar zla ra ba tshes nas /
translated: except for those who live in the country of Asmapāragaṇa, from the first day of the rainy season

original: dbyar zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba phyed dang gsum las gzhan pa'i dus su nyi ma ga las khrus bya zhing nyi ma de nyid nas zhag bco lnga pa'i mdun rol nas /
analyzed: dbyar zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba phyed dang gsum las gzhan pa'i dus su nyi ma ga las khrus bya zhing nyi ma de nyid nas zhag bco lnga pa'i mdun rol nas /
translated: Except for the three and a half months from the first day of the last summer month until the full moon of the last autumn month, one should bathe in the sun.

original: don gzhan la gzhol bas chu nyams su myong ba dang / de'i phyir ma bsams par rgal ba dang / brgyal ba la gdab pa dag ma gtogs par chu ma yin par 'bru mar dang / mar dang / phrum khu dang / 'o ma la sogs pa ma yin par chu nyid kyis dbang bskur bas sam ;
analyzed: don gzhan la gzhol bas chu nyams su myong ba dang / de'i phyir ma bsams par rgal ba dang / brgyal ba la gdab pa dag ma gtogs par chu ma yin par 'bru mar dang / mar dang / phrum khu dang / 'o ma la sogs pa ma yin par chu nyid kyis dbang bskur bas sam ;
translated: And if one does not bathe in water, but in oil, ghee, fermented grain mash, milk, and so forth, which are not water, except when one is occupied with something else and experiences water, or when one crosses a river without thinking about it, or when one is unconscious, then one commits an offense entailing confession for bathing in water or in a substitute for water.

original: 'jug pas khrus lte bar son par byed na khrus byed pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug pas khrus lte bar son par byed na khrus byed pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If one bathes in water or in a substitute for water, and the water reaches the navel, one commits an offense entailing confession for bathing.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
translated: The agent of this offense is🔽a fully ordained monk.

original: zla ba phyed kyi nang rol na /
analyzed: zla ba phyed kyi nang rol na /
translated: Within the first half of the month,

original: chu nyid kyis khrus byed pa'o //
analyzed: chu nyid kyis khrus byed pa'o //
translated: he bathes in water.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The basis of the offense is complete when five factors are present.

original: zla ba phyed la 'dums pa nyid dag dang / dus ma gtogs pa nyid dang / chu nyid dang / khrus nyid dang / mgo 'am /
analyzed: zla ba phyed la 'dums pa nyid dag dang / dus ma gtogs pa nyid dang / chu nyid dang / khrus nyid dang / mgo 'am /
translated: one should wash with water,🔽and one should wash the head,

original: rkang ngam g-yas g-yon gang nas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: rkang ngam g-yas g-yon gang nas kyang rung ste /
translated: or the feet, or the right side, or the left side,

original: lte bar son pa'o //
analyzed: lte bar son pa'o //
translated: and one should wash the navel.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If one does not have the limbs of that, then one should wash as much as one can.

original: khrus byed pa'i ltung byed de drug cu pa'o /
analyzed: khrus byed pa'i ltung byed de drug cu pa'o /
translated: This is the sixty-first downfall.

original: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo'i gzhung 'grel bam po bco lnga pa /
analyzed: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo'i gzhung 'grel bam po bco lnga pa /
translated: The Fifteenth Chapter🔽The summary: Animals, regret, fingers,🔽play, frightening, hiding, shameless, groundless,

original: sdom la / dud 'gro 'gyod pa sor mo dang // rtse dang lhan cig sdangs byed dang / sbed dang rdeng med gzhi med dang / skyes pa med par lam 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: sdom la / dud 'gro 'gyod pa sor mo dang // rtse dang lhan cig sdangs byed dang / sbed dang rdeng med gzhi med dang / skyes pa med par lam 'gro ba'o //
translated: and going on the road without a man.

original: zhes bya ba ni bcu pa bdun pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bcu pa bdun pa yin te /
translated: This is the sixty-first.

original: sdom la zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don dang dgos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sdom la zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don dang dgos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words of the summary and the purpose are the same as before.

original: bcu pa bdun pa 'dis kyang ltung byed kyi chos bcu bstan te /
analyzed: bcu pa bdun pa 'dis kyang ltung byed kyi chos bcu bstan te /
translated: This sixty-first also teaches ten downfalls that are downfalls due to degeneration.

original: dud 'gro gsod pa dang / 'gyod pa skyed pa dang / ga ga tshil byed pa dang / chu la rtse ba dang / bud med dang lhan cig nyal ba dang / sdangs par byed pa dang / sbed pa dang / byin nas nye bar 'tsho ba dang /
analyzed: dud 'gro gsod pa dang / 'gyod pa skyed pa dang / ga ga tshil byed pa dang / chu la rtse ba dang / bud med dang lhan cig nyal ba dang / sdangs par byed pa dang / sbed pa dang / byin nas nye bar 'tsho ba dang /
translated: Killing an animal, causing regret, tickling, playing in water, sleeping in the same place as a woman, frightening, hiding, giving and then using,

analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa dang / bud med dang / @196b lhan cig 'gro ba'i ltung byed do //

analyzed: de la dud 'gro gsod pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so // tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka snga dro sham thabs bgos lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te /
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.🔽The venerable Udayī, having dressed in the morning,

analyzed: mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs nas /

analyzed: des der bsod snyoms brgyus te /
translated: He went for alms in that place,🔽and he entered the archery range.

analyzed: 'phong gi 'phong sar zhugs pa dang / 'phong gi slob dpon ni med /
translated: There was no archery teacher,

analyzed: khye'u dag 'khod nas dris pa /

analyzed: khye'u dag ci byed /

analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

analyzed: 'phags pa 'phong slob bo //
translated: “Noble one, we are learning archery.”

original: 'char kas smras pa /
analyzed: 'char kas smras pa /
translated: Udayin said,

original: bu dag legs te /
analyzed: bu dag legs te /
translated: “Boys, that is good.

analyzed: khyed kyis sgyu rtsal mchog las brgal to //

analyzed: bltas g-yon 'phong dang / g-yas 'phong dang / mda' lnga phang bar byos shig / de dag gis bya bar brtsams pa dang / de lag pa gnyis 'dril bar byed bzhin sgyur bar byed do //

analyzed: da dung khyed cag gi slob dpon gyis kyang mi shes na /
translated: “If your teacher does not even know this,

translated: Bring another bow. They offered a second and a third bow, and Udayana said, These bows are also like cotton bows.

original: 'char kas smras pa /
analyzed: 'char kas smras pa /

analyzed: ji ltar je bya rog 'di'i rkub tu bsnun te khar dbyung bar bya'am /

analyzed: 'on te khar bsnun la rkub tu dbyung bar bya /

translated: “Noble one, please shoot it out of our ass.”🔽Udayana shot an arrow into the sky above the east,

original: sems khong du chud cing 'khod do //
analyzed: sems khong du chud cing 'khod do //

original: 'char kas smras pa /
analyzed: 'char kas smras pa /

analyzed: khye'u dag ci'i phyir sems khong du chud cing 'khod /

translated: They told him what had happened.🔽“

analyzed: mi'o cog la 'di skad ces /
