original: byed du bcug na chu la rtse ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed du bcug na chu la rtse ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do it yourself or you cause someone else to do it, you commit the root downfall that is a laughing matter.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
translated: The agent in this case is

original: dgod pas dga' ba nyams su myong bar bya ba'i 'dun pa dang / chu'i yul la rtse ba rjes su sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dgod pas dga' ba nyams su myong bar bya ba'i 'dun pa dang / chu'i yul la rtse ba rjes su sgrub pa'o //
translated: someone who is motivated to experience pleasure through laughter and who engages in playing in water.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /🔽dgod pas dga' ba nyams su myong bar bya ba'i 'dun pa nyid dang / chu'i yul nyid dang / lte ba nub pa nyid dang / rtse ba rjes su sgrub pa nyid dang / byed dam /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te / dgod pas dga' ba nyams su myong bar bya ba'i 'dun pa nyid dang / chu'i yul nyid dang / lte ba nub pa nyid dang / rtse ba rjes su sgrub pa nyid dang / byed dam /
translated: The root downfall occurs through five factors:

original: byed du bcug pa nyid do //
analyzed: byed du bcug pa nyid do //
translated: the motivation to experience pleasure through laughter, the object being water, the act being submerging to the navel, the action being playing, and doing it yourself or causing someone else to do it.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors are incomplete, you commit a transgression.

original: chu la rtse ba'i ltung byed de drug cu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: chu la rtse ba'i ltung byed de drug cu bzhi pa'o /
translated: This was the sixty-fourth downfall.

original: // / bud med dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / bud med dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The origin of the offense entailing confession for sleeping in the same sleeping place as a woman

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying at Jetavana, Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park near Śrāvastī.

original: gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe /
translated: At that time,

original: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas shing //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas shing //
translated: the venerable Aniruddha, having abandoned all the defilements, manifested arhatship.

original: des rnam par grol ba'i bde ba nyams su myong ba'i tshe de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: des rnam par grol ba'i bde ba nyams su myong ba'i tshe de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: When he experienced the bliss of liberation, he thought,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni bdag la phan pa mdzad pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni bdag la phan pa mdzad pa /
translated: “The Blessed One has acted for my benefit,

original: legs pa mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: legs pa mdzad pa yin te /
translated: he has acted for my well-being.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das de ni bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi chos mang po sel bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das de ni bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi chos mang po sel bar mdzad pa /
translated: In this way, the Blessed One has removed many of my painful qualities,

original: bde ba'i chos mang po sgrub pa /
analyzed: bde ba'i chos mang po sgrub pa /
translated: he has established many pleasant qualities,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mang po sel bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mang po sel bar mdzad pa /
translated: he has removed many non-virtuous qualities,

original: dge ba'i chos mang po sgrub par mdzad pa yin na /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos mang po sgrub par mdzad pa yin na /
translated: and he has established many virtuous qualities.

original: bdag gis de la ci zhig byas na /
analyzed: bdag gis de la ci zhig byas na /
translated: What can I do for him?

original: lan byas pa dang / nye bar byas pa dang / rab tu byas par 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: lan byas pa dang / nye bar byas pa dang / rab tu byas par 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: What can I do in return for his kindness, his help, and his service?

original: yang de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thought further:

original: sangs rgyas bcom 'das dka' ba mdzad pa brgya stong du ma dag gis bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis pha rol tu @202b phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par mdzad nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom 'das dka' ba mdzad pa brgya stong du ma dag gis bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis pha rol tu @202b phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par mdzad nas /
translated: “The Blessed Buddhas, after many hundreds of thousands of hardships, over three incalculable eons, completed the six perfections.🔽They attained unsurpassed knowledge for the sake of all sentient beings. I too should do something to help them.”

original: bla na med pa'i mkhyen pa thugs su chud pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni sems can gyi don gyi phyir yin pas bdag gis kyang gdul ba'i bya ba cung zhig bya'o snyam nas bcom ldan 'das la zhus nas ljongs rgyur song ngo //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i mkhyen pa thugs su chud pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni sems can gyi don gyi phyir yin pas bdag gis kyang gdul ba'i bya ba cung zhig bya'o snyam nas bcom ldan 'das la zhus nas ljongs rgyur song ngo //
translated: He asked the Blessed One and then went on his travels.

original: ri brags shig na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa de la bu gnyis dang / bu mo gcig yod nas /
analyzed: ri brags shig na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa de la bu gnyis dang / bu mo gcig yod nas /
translated: In a certain mountain village there lived a householder who had two sons and a daughter.

original: des bu de gnyis kyi khyim phub cing /
analyzed: des bu de gnyis kyi khyim phub cing /
translated: He built houses for his two sons

original: bu mo de yang bag mar btang ngo //
analyzed: bu mo de yang bag mar btang ngo //
translated: and gave his daughter in marriage.

original: dus gzhan zhig na khyim bdag de yang dus la bab /
analyzed: dus gzhan zhig na khyim bdag de yang dus la bab /
translated: Later, the householder died.

original: de'i bu mo'i yang khyo shi bar gyur nas /
analyzed: de'i bu mo'i yang khyo shi bar gyur nas /
translated: Then his daughter’s husband died.

original: ming po gnyis ni khyim na gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: ming po gnyis ni khyim na gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: The two brothers remained in the house.

original: skyes pa gzhan dag dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyod pa las khye'u spyi brtol can zhes bya ba gcig byung nas /
analyzed: skyes pa gzhan dag dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyod pa las khye'u spyi brtol can zhes bya ba gcig byung nas /
translated: While they were enjoying themselves with other men, a son named Audayī was born.

original: de'i ma yang spyi brtol can gyi ma zhes bya ba'i ming du gyur to //
analyzed: de'i ma yang spyi brtol can gyi ma zhes bya ba'i ming du gyur to //
translated: His mother was also called Audayī’s mother.

original: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba na /
translated: The venerable Aniruddha was traveling through the country.

original: ri brags der phyin nas /
analyzed: ri brags der phyin nas /
translated: He arrived at that hill town.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams chos nyid kyis ma bsams par shes pa dang mthong ba mi 'jug pas de der song nas /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams chos nyid kyis ma bsams par shes pa dang mthong ba mi 'jug pas de der song nas /
translated: Because it is the nature of arhats that they do not act without thinking, he went there.

original: bsti gnas brnyas nas der 'dug pa dang / des der rkang pa bkru ba'i chu dang / rkang ba bsku ba dang / dus ma yin pa'i zas bstabs pa dag ni des ma blangs so //
analyzed: bsti gnas brnyas nas der 'dug pa dang / des der rkang pa bkru ba'i chu dang / rkang ba bsku ba dang / dus ma yin pa'i zas bstabs pa dag ni des ma blangs so //
translated: He stayed there, having found a place to stay. He did not accept the water for washing the feet, the foot salve, or the untimely food that was offered to him there.

original: des de'i mal bshams pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa mal der skyil mo krung bcas nas lus drang por bsrang ste dran pa phyogs par bzhag nas 'dug go //
analyzed: des de'i mal bshams pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa mal der skyil mo krung bcas nas lus drang por bsrang ste dran pa phyogs par bzhag nas 'dug go //
translated: He prepared a bed for him, and Venerable Aniruddha sat down cross-legged on the bed, straightened his body, and set up mindfulness in front of him.

original: de de'i gan du mtshan mo'i thun dang po nam phyed na 'ongs te /
analyzed: de de'i gan du mtshan mo'i thun dang po nam phyed na 'ongs te /
translated: In the first part of the night, she came to him.

original: bud mad kyi g-yo dag nye bar bstan par brtsams pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa dbang po dag 'bebs par byed do //
analyzed: bud mad kyi g-yo dag nye bar bstan par brtsams pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa dbang po dag 'bebs par byed do //
translated: She began to display her feminine wiles, but Venerable Aniruddha lowered his senses.

original: des 'khyud par brtsams pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa dang pa'i rgyal po 'dab ma brkyang ba ltar steng gi nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags nas /
analyzed: des 'khyud par brtsams pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa dang pa'i rgyal po 'dab ma brkyang ba ltar steng gi nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags nas /
translated: When she tried to embrace him, Venerable Aniruddha rose up into the sky like a king goose with outstretched wings.

original: 'bar ba dang / gsal ba dang / char 'bebs pa dang / glog 'byin pa'i cho 'phrul dag bya bar brtsams nas /
analyzed: 'bar ba dang / gsal ba dang / char 'bebs pa dang / glog 'byin pa'i cho 'phrul dag bya bar brtsams nas /
translated: He performed the miracles of fire, light, rain, and lightning.

original: bud med de la rjes su snying brtse ba'i phyir steng gi nam mkha' las shod du babs te /
analyzed: bud med de la rjes su snying brtse ba'i phyir steng gi nam mkha' las shod du babs te /
translated: Out of compassion for that woman, he descended from the sky to the ground.

original: de'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / rang bzhin khong du chud nas gang thos nas /
analyzed: de'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / rang bzhin khong du chud nas gang thos nas /
translated: and having understood her thoughts, her latent tendencies, her temperament, and her nature, he taught her the Dharma.

original: bud med des stan de nyid la 'dug bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom ste /🔽rgyun tu @203a * //
analyzed: bud med des stan de nyid la 'dug bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom ste / rgyun tu @203a * //
translated: Then, while she was sitting right there, she destroyed with the vajra of knowledge the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the transitory collection,🔽and manifested the fruit of stream-entry.

original: zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas pa de lta bur 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yang dag par so sor rig par byed pa'i chos bstan pa byas pas des bden pa mthong nas phyi de nyin bar /
analyzed: zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas pa de lta bur 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yang dag par so sor rig par byed pa'i chos bstan pa byas pas des bden pa mthong nas phyi de nyin bar /
translated: In this way, he taught the Dharma in such a way that she saw the truths. The next day,🔽the noble Aniruddha served the meal in a closed room.

original: 'phags pa ma 'gags pa sgo bcad de gdugs tshod gsol nas chos bstan pa'i tshe de'i ming po gnyis /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma 'gags pa sgo bcad de gdugs tshod gsol nas chos bstan pa'i tshe de'i ming po gnyis /
translated: When he taught the Dharma, her two brothers

original: mi zhig dang lhan cig 'thab mo byung ba na /
analyzed: mi zhig dang lhan cig 'thab mo byung ba na /
translated: got into a fight with a man.

original: mi de na re khyed gnyis dang smra'am /
analyzed: mi de na re khyed gnyis dang smra'am /
translated: The man said, “Do you two talk to me?

original: khyed gnyis kyi sring mo ya mtshan can sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i mchod sbyin byed pas sh'akya'i bu dge sbyong yang ma btang ste /
analyzed: khyed gnyis kyi sring mo ya mtshan can sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i mchod sbyin byed pas sh'akya'i bu dge sbyong yang ma btang ste /
translated: “Your sister is performing a sacrifice with various wondrous things. She has not let go of the ascetic Śākya son.

original: sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong yang khar rtsang zhugs na da dung yang ma byung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong yang khar rtsang zhugs na da dung yang ma byung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Yesterday she entered the ascetic Śākya son, but he has not come out yet.”

original: de gnyis kyis bsams pa /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis bsams pa /
translated: The two of them thought,

original: bdag cag nyis gang cung zad mis brnyas par gyur pa de thams cad ni 'di'i le lan yin gyis /
analyzed: bdag cag nyis gang cung zad mis brnyas par gyur pa de thams cad ni 'di'i le lan yin gyis /
translated: “Whatever slight contempt people have for us is all his fault.

original: de gsad du 'dong ngo snyam nas /
analyzed: de gsad du 'dong ngo snyam nas /
translated: Let’s go kill him.”

original: ral gri shubs nas phyung ste /
analyzed: ral gri shubs nas phyung ste /
translated: They drew their swords from their scabbards

original: de'i khyim ga la bde logs su phyogs te brgyugs pa dang ; srog chags brgya stong phrag du ma dag kyang /
analyzed: de'i khyim ga la bde logs su phyogs te brgyugs pa dang ; srog chags brgya stong phrag du ma dag kyang /
translated: and ran toward his house. Many hundreds of thousands of living beings

original: kha cig ni ltad mo skyes pa na /
analyzed: kha cig ni ltad mo skyes pa na /
translated: some because they were curious

original: kha cig ni sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gis bskul ba na /
analyzed: kha cig ni sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gis bskul ba na /
translated: and some because they were urged on by their roots of virtue in the past

original: de gnyis kyi phyi bzhin phyi bzhin rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi phyi bzhin phyi bzhin rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: followed after the two of them.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas smras pa /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas smras pa /
translated: Then Venerable Aniruddha said,🔽“Friends, friends, don’t do this!

original: sring mo kho bo phyir byung gis /
analyzed: sring mo kho bo phyir byung gis /
translated: “Sister, I’m coming out.🔽You close the door.”

original: khyod kyis sgo chod cig / de phyir byung ba dang des sgo bcad do //
analyzed: khyod kyis sgo chod cig / de phyir byung ba dang des sgo bcad do //
translated: When he came out, she closed the door.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas ngang pa'i rgyal po 'dab ma brkyang ba ltar steng gi nam mkha' la 'phags nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas ngang pa'i rgyal po 'dab ma brkyang ba ltar steng gi nam mkha' la 'phags nas /
translated: Then Venerable Aniruddha rose up into the sky like a king goose stretching its wings,

original: cho 'phrul dag bya bar brtsams nas shod du babs te /
analyzed: cho 'phrul dag bya bar brtsams nas shod du babs te /
translated: and he began to perform miracles.

original: chos bstan pas srog chags nyi khris rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par byas so //
analyzed: chos bstan pas srog chags nyi khris rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par byas so //
translated: He descended to the ground and taught the Dharma, causing twenty thousand beings to attain the fruit of stream-entry.

original: ri brags de dang ha cang mi ring ba na skyed mos tshal zhig yod pa der mtshan mo gnas par khas blangs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: ri brags de dang ha cang mi ring ba na skyed mos tshal zhig yod pa der mtshan mo gnas par khas blangs pa'i tshe /
translated: Not far from that town was a park, and he agreed to stay there for the night.

original: chom rkun pa lnga brgya tsam der lhags pa dag la yang chos bstan pas /
analyzed: chom rkun pa lnga brgya tsam der lhags pa dag la yang chos bstan pas /
translated: At that time, about five hundred thieves came to the park. He taught the Dharma to them as well,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par byas pa yin no //
translated: and they attained the fruit of stream-entry.

original: ri brags pa de dag pa chos bstan pas srog chags khri nyis stong gis kyang 'phags pa'i 'bras bu thob par byas so //
analyzed: ri brags pa de dag pa chos bstan pas srog chags khri nyis stong gis kyang 'phags pa'i 'bras bu thob par byas so //
translated: And through teaching the Dharma to those bandits, twelve thousand beings attained the fruit of the noble ones.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas chom rkun pa las bden pa mthong ba'i rigs kyi bu lnga brgya po de dag bcom ldan 'das la gdul ba'i skyes su khrid de /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas chom rkun pa las bden pa mthong ba'i rigs kyi bu lnga brgya po de dag bcom ldan 'das la gdul ba'i skyes su khrid de /
translated: Then the venerable Aniruddha led the five hundred sons of good family who had seen the truth from the bandits to the Blessed One to be tamed.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song nas /
translated: They went to where the Blessed One was.

original: @203b bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de dag dge slong tshur shog ces bya bas rab tu phyung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas /
analyzed: @203b bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de dag dge slong tshur shog ces bya bas rab tu phyung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par mdzad nas /
translated: The Blessed One also ordained them with the words, Come, monks! and gave them full ordination.

original: de dag gis dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: de dag gis dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas so //
translated: They manifested arhatship.

original: dge slong rnams kyis tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa la dris pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa la dris pa /
translated: The monks asked the venerable Aniruddha,

original: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa ji ltar bde bar brgyus sam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa ji ltar bde bar brgyus sam /
translated: Venerable Aniruddha, how did you travel comfortably?

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag cung zad ni bde bar brgyus cung zad ni sdug bsngal bar yang brgyus so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag cung zad ni bde bar brgyus cung zad ni sdug bsngal bar yang brgyus so //
translated: Venerable ones, I traveled comfortably a little bit, but I also traveled uncomfortably a little bit.

original: ji ltar 'di ltar re zhig gdul ba'i bya ba byas pa gang yin pa de ni bde bar brgyus pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di ltar re zhig gdul ba'i bya ba byas pa gang yin pa de ni bde bar brgyus pa yin no //
translated: “As for the one who has already done what he had to do in the way of taming, he is well-harnessed.

original: had por de'u gsad pa gnag yin pa de ni sdug bsngal bar yang brgyus pa yin no //
analyzed: had por de'u gsad pa gnag yin pa de ni sdug bsngal bar yang brgyus pa yin no //
translated: As for the one who has not done what he had to do in the way of taming, he is badly-harnessed.

original: ci'i phyir des skabs de rgyas par brjod pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir des skabs de rgyas par brjod pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: Why did he elaborate on that occasion?

original: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa khyod bud med dang lhan cig gnas gcig tu nyal du rung ngam gang gi phyir mi rung ba de nyid kyi phyir nyes dmigs byung bar gyur to zhes zer na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa khyod bud med dang lhan cig gnas gcig tu nyal du rung ngam gang gi phyir mi rung ba de nyid kyi phyir nyes dmigs byung bar gyur to zhes zer na /
translated: The monks said, “Venerable Aniruddha, is it proper to sleep in the same room as a woman? Because it is not proper, a problem arose.”

original: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir /
translated: “Why do the monks who have few desires🔽criticize the monks, saying,

original: dge slong gang dag bud med dang lhan cig gnas gcig tu nyal zhes smod par byed /
analyzed: dge slong gang dag bud med dang lhan cig gnas gcig tu nyal zhes smod par byed /
translated: ‘They sleep in the same room as a woman’?🔽They gossip and

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /🔽kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed / kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
translated: criticize them.”

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
translated: The Blessed One then did as he had before.

original: yang dge slong gang bud med dang lhan cig gnas gcig tu nyal na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang bud med dang lhan cig gnas gcig tu nyal na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: Again, the Blessed One laid down a rule: If a monk sleeps in the same sleeping place as a woman, he commits an offense.

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa /
translated: The person was the venerable Aniruddha.

original: nyon mongs pa ni bag chags ma byang bsam bsams par shes pa dang mthong ba mi 'jug pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni bag chags ma byang bsam bsams par shes pa dang mthong ba mi 'jug pa /
translated: The affliction was the non-purification of habitual tendencies, which caused him to sleep without knowing or seeing.

original: nyes pa ni bud med dang lhan cig gnas gcig tu nyal ba'o//

translated: A monk, whether he is thinking to joke or whether he is motivated by anger,
